intro: Psychotria cylindrostipula, commonly known as the red-stemmed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, red-colored stems and small, elliptical leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Psychotria cylindrostipula is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
